intro: Isophyllum, commonly known as the common isophyllum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Isophyllum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
